description: From Middle English touselen, equivalent to touse +â€Ž -le.

entries.meaning: The action of ruffling or setting in disorder.
examples: Cassie reached over and gave Sammy's dark hair a tousle.

verbs.description: tousle (third-person singular simple present tousles, present participle tousling, simple past and past participle tousled)

entries.meaning: To put into disorder; to tumble; to touse; to muss.
